meanings.definition: A person who supervises and coordinates the serving staff in a restaurant.
meanings.sent1: The headwaiters ensured the tables were set correctly for the evening rush.
meanings.sent2: The headwaiters greeted customers and assigned them to their tables.
meanings.sent3: The headwaiters joked about having eyes in the back of their heads to keep an eye on the servers.
meanings.sent4: The headwaiters were the conductors of the dining orchestra, orchestrating a seamless service.
meanings.sent5: The headwaiters' authoritative presence made them stand out in the bustling restaurant.

meanings.definition: The plural form of headwaiter, referring to multiple individuals in the same role.
meanings.sent1: The headwaiters in the restaurant all wore matching uniforms.
meanings.sent2: The headwaiters were busy attending to the needs of the diners.
meanings.sent3: The headwaiters formed a team that worked together like a well-oiled machine.
meanings.sent4: The headwaiters stood out in their group, each bringing their unique style to the role.
meanings.sent5: The headwaiters' camaraderie was evident in their synchronized movements around the dining area.
